019package org.jgrapes.io.util;
020
021import java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue;
022import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
023import java.util.HashSet;
024import java.util.Set;
025
026/**
027 * Cleans up threads if some object has been garbage collected.
028 * 
029 * Sometimes it is necessary to create a thread that delivers data
030 * to a synchronous consumer. This thread keeps the consumer running
031 * until the consumer expects no more input and thus terminates
032 * the thread.
033 * 
034 * Due to an error condition it may happen, however, that the terminating
035 * event never occurs and the thread runs forever. As a possible remedy,
036 * this class allows the thread to be associated with the lifetime of an
037 * arbitrary object. When the object is garbage collected, the thread is
038 * terminated automatically.
039 * 
040 * @since 2.8.0
041 */
042public final class ThreadCleaner {
043
044    private static Set<RefWithThread> watched = new HashSet<>();
045    private static ReferenceQueue<Object> abandoned
046        = new ReferenceQueue<>();
047
048    private ThreadCleaner() {
049        // Utility class
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Weak references to an object that interrupts the associated
054     * thread if the object has been garbage collected.
055     *
056     * @param <T> the generic type
057     */
058    private static class RefWithThread extends WeakReference<Object> {
059        public final Thread watched;
060
061        /**
062         * Creates a new instance.
063         *
064         * @param referent the referent
065         * @param thread the thread
066         */
067        public RefWithThread(Object referent, Thread thread) {
068            super(referent, abandoned);
069            watched = thread;
070        }
071    }
072
073    static {
074        Thread watchdog = new Thread(() -> {
075            Thread.currentThread().setName("ThreadCleaner");
076            while (true) {
077                try {
078                    ThreadCleaner.RefWithThread ref
079                        = (ThreadCleaner.RefWithThread) abandoned.remove();
080                    ref.watched.interrupt();
081                    watched.remove(ref);
082                } catch (InterruptedException e) { // NOPMD
083                    // Nothing to do
084                }
085            }
086        });
087        watchdog.setDaemon(true);
088        watchdog.start();
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Watch the referent and terminate the thread if it is
093     * garbage collected.
094     *
095     * @param referent the referent
096     * @param thread the thread
097     */
098    public static void watch(Object referent, Thread thread) {
099        watched.add(new RefWithThread(referent, thread));
100    }
101}
